Package ohos.utils

Class Stopwatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.utils.Stopwatch

  • public final class Stopwatch
extends Object
    Provides the stopwatch function to log execution of subtasks split from a main task and uses HiLog to save the records in debug-level logs.

    Example code: 

     Stopwatch stopwatch = new Stopwatch(label, "main task");
 // Records the completion time of subtask A split from the main task.
 stopwatch.split("sub task A");
 // Records the completion time of subtask B split from the main task.
 stopwatch.split("sub task B");
 // Records the completion time of subtask C split from the main task.
 stopwatch.split("sub task C");
 stopwatch.writeLog();

    The following records are written into the logs: 

     8186 D 00000/StopwatchDemo: main task: begin
 8186 D 00000/StopwatchDemo: main task:      11 ms, 11%, sub task A
 8186 D 00000/StopwatchDemo: main task:      76 ms, 76%, sub task B
 8186 D 00000/StopwatchDemo: main task:      13 ms, 13%, sub task C
 8186 D 00000/StopwatchDemo: main task: end  100 ms
    Since:
    2

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stopwatch

        public Stopwatch​(HiLogLabel label,
                 String taskName)
        Creates a stopwatch logger.

        You are advised to create one stopwatch logger for each main task.

        Parameters:
        label - Indicates the HiLog label.
        taskName - Indicates the task name.
        Since:
        2
        See Also:
        HiLogLabel

    • Method Detail

      • split

        public void split​(String subtaskName)
        Records the completion time of a subtask split from the main task.

        This method is called after a subtask is executed. Stopwatch#writeLog() uses the recorded time to calculate the subtask execution duration.

        Parameters:
        subtaskName - Indicates the subtask name.
        Since:
        2

      • reset

        public void reset​()
        Resets the stopwatch logger.

        If a main task needs to be repeatedly executed, call this method to reset the stopwatch logger. After the reset, all of the history records will be cleared.

        Since:
        2

      • writeLog

        public void writeLog​()
        Writes the records in the stopwatch logger into the debug-level logs defined in HiLog.

        Note: This method does not clear history records, which will also be written into the logs. To clear the history records, call Stopwatch#reset().

        Since:
        2
